alert.note: Alert for Johnson (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued February 17 at 10:24PM EST until February 18 at 10:00PM EST by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...The Flood Advisory is extended for the following river in Kentucky... Levisa Fork Big Sandy River at Paintsville affecting Johnson County. ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE SATURDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Levisa Fork Big Sandy River at Paintsville. * WHEN...Until late Saturday evening. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:45 PM EST Friday the stage was 28.5 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise to 29.3 feet Saturday morning. It will then fall to 24.1 feet early Sunday afternoon. It will rise to 24.5 feet early Monday morning. It will then fall again and remain below flood stage. - Action stage is 28.0 feet. - Flood stage is 35.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: If you encounter a flooded roadway, turn around and find an alternative route. The next statement will be issued by 8 am est Saturday morning.
